title: Perspectives on Data
copy:
Perspectives on Data

This publication, the second in the three-volume Perspectives series, explores the potentials and pitfalls of using data and data-oriented approaches in art, art history, and museums through essays, interviews, and a video that address topics such as data analysis and visualization, the design of collection management systems, and the representation of provenance.

Credits

The Human Shape of Data
The Sound and Voice of Violent Things: Against the Silence of Data Visualization
Mapping Senufo: Making Visible Debatable Information and Situated Knowledge
Taking Care of History: Toward a Politics of Provenance Linked Open Data in Museums
Crowdsourcing Metadata in Museums: Expanding Descriptions, Access, Transparency, and Experience
Iterative Pasts and Linked Futures: A Feminist Approach to Modeling Data in Archives and Collections of Artists’ Publishing
